含义: The character '权' (quán) primarily means 'power', 'authority', or 'right'. It can also refer to 'weight' in certain contexts, such as in the measurement of weight.
字形: The character '权' is composed of two parts: the left radical '木' (mù), which means 'wood' or 'tree', and the right component '又' (yòu), which historically represents a hand. The combination suggests the idea of holding or wielding power, as if holding a wooden staff or scepter.
读音: The pronunciation of '权' is 'quán' in Mandarin Chinese.
字源: The character '权' originates from ancient Chinese scripts. The '木' radical indicates its connection to wood, possibly symbolizing a staff or scepter as a symbol of authority. The '又' component, representing a hand, emphasizes the action of holding or wielding this authority.
常用词组: 权贵 (quán guì) - the powerful and wealthy
成语: 权衡利弊 (quán héng lì bì) - to weigh the pros and cons
权宜之计 (quán yí zhī jì) - a stopgap measure
大权在握 (dà quán zài wò) - to hold great power
权倾朝野 (quán qīng cháo yě) - to wield immense power
例句: 他掌握了公司的权力。 (Tā zhǎngwòle gōngsī de quánlì.) - He holds the power of the company.
权衡利弊后，他决定辞职。 (Quánhéng lìbì hòu, tā juédìng cízhí.) - After weighing the pros and cons, he decided to resign.
短故事: 在古代，有一位国王，他手握大权，但总是权衡利弊，以确保他的决定对国家有利。 (In ancient times, there was a king who held great power but always weighed the pros and cons to ensure his decisions benefited the country.)
一位智者告诉年轻的王子，真正的权力不在于控制他人，而在于自我控制。 (A wise man told the young prince that true power lies not in controlling others, but in self-control.)
